str2: Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A linen bandage, a wrapping. Neuter of a presumed derivative of othone; a linen bandage.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
